intro: Psychotria carrascoana, commonly known as the "Carrascoana Psychotria," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Colombia and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a smooth texture. Psychotria carrascoana is often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests.
